summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys discussing the drafting of a motion to dismiss (MTD) and an amicus letter related to a 'GM appeal' in the Epstein case. It shows coordination on legal filings on a weekend, indicating urgency or importance.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender/recipient of the email chain, coordinating the drafting of legal documents (a motion to dismiss and an amicus letter) for a 'GM appeal'.

events.title: Drafting of GM Appeal Documents
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys coordinate via email on a Sunday to draft a motion to dismiss and a potential amicus letter related to a 'GM appeal'.

events.title: Finalization of GM Appeal Motion
events.description: An updated version of a motion to dismiss document ('Government MTD_GM_Interlocutory_Appeal_v3.docx') is shared via email for final review before sending.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.address: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: The office location of the Assistant United States Attorney(s) involved in the correspondence.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain showing coordination among prosecutors on a weekend (September 13-14, 2020) regarding a legal appeal.
The subject is a 'GM appeal,' likely referring to Ghislaine Maxwell, given the context of the Epstein case documents.
The attorneys are working on a motion to dismiss (MTD) and discuss drafting an amicus letter.
The correspondence indicates urgency, with attorneys working on a Sunday and having 'carved out time' to complete the task.
The document originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
